newsitem.title: LEBANON: Lebanon's banking activity up in July.
newsitem.headline: Lebanon's banking activity up in July.

text.p: The consolidated balance sheet of Lebanon's commercial banks rose 2.88 percent in July to 32,481 billion Lebanese pounds, the Bank of Lebanon said in its latest monthly bulletin.
Total deposits in foreign currencies and Lebanese pounds rose 2.86 percent to 27,048 billion pounds from 26,295 billion in June, it said.
Lebanese pound deposits grew 3.72 percent to 10,995 billion pounds from 10,601 billion a month earlier.
Deposits in foreign currencies rose 2.57 percent to $10.247 billion in July compared with $9.990 in June, the Bank added.
Loans and credits to the private sector rose 2.07 percent in July over June, increasing to 11,736 billion pounds.
Credits in Lebanese pounds rose 3.48 percent in July to 1,567 billion from 1,514 billion pounds a month earlier. Credits in foreign currencies rose 2.15 percent to $6.509 billion from $6,372 billion.
